ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned the proper way to read a scholarly book as a historian. I also learned the proper tools to think critically about historical events and debates.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The readings were manageable and interesting, and I always felt that preparing for the class was rewarding. Discussions could be a little slow & lacking in participation.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This class was a great survey of antisemitism throughout history. Learned a lot of new things about the familiar topics like the Holocaust and blood libel. Really like the freedom to choose presentation and paper topics
If you haven't read much on the topic, and are looking for a survey of interesting readings and helpful contextualizations provided by the professor, I would recommend.
Chillest class at Yale. Zero work. Hidden gem of a gut.
